ovdesc.p: The T24 Auto Function allows records to be processed without user intervention at each record level.
This facility can be used at takeover time to load data which has been written to the $NAU file in Hold Status and thus the T24 cross validation checks are performed on the data.
This facility can also be used to Print a large number of records.

desc.p: A sequence of automated actions to be applied to each of the selected records.
Similar in function to INPUT.BUFFER field and allows the same type of input as described for that field.
Any instructions entered in this field are executed after the sequence of instructions in INPUT.BUFFER.

The "KEYSTROKE" instructions are executed in a slightly different way from those contained in "INPUT BUFFER". They are for use in special cases only, where it is necessary to execute a sequence of commands which are not supported by the standard T24 Input Buffer (their behaviour can be likened to "forcing" the sequence of instructions).
An example of this is the processing of Loans.and.Deposits records with schedules attached.
The use of this field is only valid when processing in single-record groups.
1-35 type A (alpha numeric) characters. Multivalue field. (Optional input)
Input only allowed if sample size is 1.
Defines the field name from the associated standard selection record to be totalled across the records selected.
Fields of type D or I may be used. If the field is not numeric a result of zero will be returned. If the field is a multivalued field then all the multivalues will be added into the total.
Up to 50 type A (alpha numeric) characters. Multivalue field. (Optional input)
Must exist on the associated standard selection record.
This field is reserved for future expansion.
This is a NOINPUT field.
Allows selection criteria to be applied, i.e allows the user to select certain records from the file for processing.
The UniVerse selection criteria apply. This field should contain whatever you wish to concatenate to the SELECT filename command, for your processing:
e.g. WITH @ID LIKE A...
The multivalue field allows you to expand the selection request.
If this field is left blank then the whole file is selected.
Up to 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Multivalue field. (Optional input).
This field is reserved for future expansion.
This is a NOINPUT field.
Defines the version of the file input routine to be used if any.
The file name is not entered only a comma followed by the version name.
Up to 20 type A (alpha numeric) characters, starting with a comma. (Optional input)
The file name plus what is entered in this field must be on the VERSION file.
Defines the number of records to be processed before returning to the control screen.
Records selected by EBS.AUTO.FUNCTION are processed in groups, the size of each group (or sample) being determined by this field.
The program returns control to the EBS.AUTO.FUNCTION screen after each group of records is processed.
The larger the sample size, the less frequently control returns to this screen and, consequently, the faster the entire process completes.
A smaller sample size is useful in situations where the process may be interrupted, either by the user or by an error condition.
If there is a problem with one of the records in the group for the sample size then the remaining records are not processed.
The sample size controls where F4 pause option will come into effect (i.e. only after each full group).
Up to 4 numeric characters - Defaults to 1. (Mandatory Input)
Contains the text to be displayed with the associated total field.

This field is to be used to display a narrative to the total produced due to the TOTAL FIELD. The & character may be used to position the total within the narrative, otherwise the total will be appended.
Example: "TOTAL OF & IS FOR DEBIT AMOUNT"
Up to 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Multivalue field. (Optional input)
Required if associated total field is present.
This field is reserved for future expansion.
This is a NOINPUT field.
Identifies the file on which the auto function is to be processed.
The file must have an associated H U L T or W type program of the same name as defined on the PGM.FILE.
A sequence number is appended to the file name, thus allowing different auto-functions to be set up per file.
On inputting the application name only, the users terminal number is concatenated on to the end of the id, as a default.
Abbreviations may be used.
Up to 30 alphanumeric characters. (Mandatory input.)
Defines whether the live or unauthorised file is to be processed.
If this field is null then this routine uses the $NAU file for its processing. If the $NAU file is not available this field will be defaulted to NO which means the live file will be used.
NO (Optional input)
Contains the T24 function which is to be applied to each of the records selected.
This field can contain any of the following:
A - Authorise D - Delete H - History I - Input P - Print R - Reverse S - See V - Verify
1 character. (Mandatory input)
The function must be valid for file type.
A sequence of automated actions to be applied to each of the selected records.
Each action is to be indicated in a separate value of this multivalued field.
The following special inputs are recognised:
a) The keyword 'ID', which automatically brings up the next selected record.
b) Function keys which are indicated by F1 F2 F3 etc.
c) Subroutines which are indicated by preceding the subroutine name with the @ character.
All other 'Input' is treated as a literal command as though is were typed at the keyboard.
A typical sequence of actions would start with the keyword 'ID' and finish with the function key 'F5'.
1-35 type A (alpha numeric) characters. Multivalue field. (Mandatory input.)
